workflow.title: Purely digital workflow
workflow.subtitle: From scan to product. Controlled precision at every step.

retainers.title: Retention Splints
retainers.description: Digitally engineered retention splints providing full control over the insertion path and seating stability. Based on 3D scans, they allow for precise management of geometry, thickness, and retention zones—capabilities unattainable with traditional thermoforming methods.

guards.title: Occlusal Splints
guards.description: Splints designed for protection against bruxism. Variable material thickness—2mm in occlusal zones, 1mm in non-load bearing areas. Significantly higher structural and material durability compared to traditional thermoforming methods.

aligners.title: Whitening Trays
aligners.description: Custom-designed whitening trays based on 3D scans. Precise anatomical fit with controlled thickness for maximum comfort and predictable whitening results.

fixedRetainer.title: Printed Fixed Retainers
fixedRetainer.description: Digitally designed fixed retention crafted via 3D printing using biocompatible medical resin. Unlike traditional wires bent by hand on a model, our method ensures an ultra-precise fit, predictable strength, and complete repeatability.

injection.title: Injection Template System
injection.description: A digital system for Class I restorations, based on pre-preparation scans. A 3D printed mold enables flow composite injection and 1:1 anatomy reconstruction as an alternative to ceramic inlays.

precision.title: 1:1 Replication
precision.desc: Precise anatomy reconstruction from pre-op data

time.title: Minimal steps
time.desc: Simplified clinical protocol with no lab stage

technology.title: Technology
technology.description: We utilize advanced 3D printing and digital design technologies to create precise dental solutions from scan data.

contact.title: Start a partnership
contact.subtitle: Contact us to learn more about our solutions.

company.title: About us
company.description: A digital dental laboratory specializing in precise 3D printing.

footer.copyright: APM Digital Dental Lab. All rights reserved.

software.title: Next-generation CAD/CAM
software.subtitle: for digital dentistry
software.vision: We are working on the next generation of CAD/CAM software, designed from the ground up for modern digital dentistry. Not as another interface layer—but as a new engine.

why.title: Why a new system?
why.description: Today's CAD/CAM solutions originated over a decade ago. They are stable and proven—but technologically based on architecture not designed for AI or GPUs.
why.new: A system that understands tooth anatomy

anatomy.title: Digital anatomy
anatomy.desc: Analysis of shape, structure, and color directly from 3D scan data

recognition.title: Smart recognition
recognition.desc: Automatic detection, numbering, and classification of teeth

reconstruction.title: AI-driven reconstruction
reconstruction.desc: Geometry restoration preserving anatomy, occlusion, and proportions

philosophy.title: Development Philosophy
philosophy.description: We don't build 'everything at once'. We build exactly what has the greatest clinical and technological impact.

software.closing: We aren't fixing existing tools. We are designing what should exist if CAD/CAM were created today from scratch.

professionalGate.title: Professional Content
professionalGate.description: This site contains specialized information intended for the dental industry. By continuing, you confirm that you are a dental professional or dental technician.

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.note: Prices may vary based on specifications and volume

cta.title: Interested in a partnership?
cta.subtitle: Contact us to discuss details and begin the digital transformation of your practice.

retainers.title: Retention Splints
description: Digitally engineered retention splints provide complete control over the insertion path and seating stability. Unlike traditional thermoforming methods, our solution enables precise management of geometry, thickness, and retention zones.
By 3D printing with certified medical materials, we achieve significantly higher mechanical strength, translating to long-term reliability in daily use.
features: Precise retention zone geometry designed from 3D data
Controlled insertion and removal path for patient comfort
Significantly higher durability than thermoformed splints
Medical material certified for long-term contact
Predictable retention thanks to digital process control

guards.title: Occlusal Splints
description: Splints designed for maximum protection against bruxism. We utilize advanced CAD/CAM design to create variable material thickness—2mm in occlusal zones for force absorption, and 1mm in non-load bearing areas for comfort.

Digitally controlled thickness zones ensure optimal load distribution and long-term tissue protection. Significantly higher material strength compared to traditional thermoforming guarantees product longevity.
features: Variable thickness adapted to occlusal force distribution
Optimal load distribution in occlusal zones
Multi-fold higher strength than thermoformed splints
Material resistant to long-term mechanical stress

aligners.title: Whitening Trays
aligners.tagline: Precision and comfort in whitening therapy
description: Individually designed whitening trays based on precise 3D scans. Each tray is engineered with patient anatomy in mind, ensuring a perfect fit and controlled thickness for comfort during therapy.
Optimized gel reservoirs guarantee even distribution of the whitening agent, while controlled geometry ensures predictable therapy results with minimal patient discomfort.
features: Designed from 3D scan data for a perfect fit
Controlled gel reservoirs for even whitening
Optimized wall thickness for wear comfort
Medical material safe for oral tissues
Predictable whitening effects via digital control

fixedRetainer.title: Printed Fixed Retainers
fixedRetainer.tagline: Digital precision instead of manual bending
description: Digitally designed fixed retention crafted via 3D printing using biocompatible medical resin. Each retainer is individually designed based on 3D scans, ensuring a perfect fit to the patient's dental arch anatomy.

Unlike traditional steel wires bent by hand on a model, our method eliminates the risk of manual error, ensures full geometry repeatability, and controlled material strength. The biocompatible resin features high mechanical resistance and long-term retention stability.
features: CAD/CAM design from precise 3D scan data
Ultra-accurate fit to dental arch anatomy

hero.label: How we work
hero.title: Simple process. Precise result.
hero.subtitle: Three steps separate a scan from a finished product in the practice.

scan.title: Clinical data & preferences
scan.description: The practice sends a 3D scan electronically. The dentist contacts us by email or phone to discuss detailed requirements and design preferences.
scan.time: A few minutes on the practice's end

produce.title: Design, production & quality check
produce.description: We design the product individually based on scan data, 3D-print it with certified medical materials, and verify it against specifications before shipping.
produce.time: Design ~1 h · Print ~6 h · QA ~2 h

ship.title: Shipping & clinical application
ship.description: The finished product is delivered by courier within 1–3 business days. Thanks to digital precision, it is ready for immediate application upon arrival — no additional adjustments needed.

summary.label: Fast turnaround
summary.title: Design and production in one business day.
summary.subtitle: Digital workflow removes unnecessary steps. From scan approval to finished product — everything happens the same day.
summary.disclaimer: Times refer to standard orders. We are prepared for high-volume production — for larger batches lead time may vary slightly, though we do everything to prevent that.

cta.title: Interested in working together?
cta.subtitle: Get in touch — we'll discuss the details and prepare your first order.

whyDigital.label: Technical advantage
whyDigital.title: Digital precision vs thermoforming
whyDigital.subtitle: Digital production eliminates manual and material variability – every product is identical to the CAD design.

rows.digital: ±10 µm — full CAD control from 3D scan data
Zone-based, precisely designed (e.g. 2 mm occlusal / 1 mm lateral)
rows.traditional: Uniform or random — thinning up to 30–35%

rows.digital: KeySplint Hard: 60–65 MPa flexural strength, wear resistance equal to lab-processed PMMA
rows.traditional: Good initially — higher susceptibility to creep and local weakening under bruxism load

rows.digital: 100% — every unit identical to the digital file
rows.traditional: Dependent on film, heating parameters and technician experience

whyDigital.footnote: Comparison based on material studies (ISO 20795-2, wear studies KeySplint vs Lucitone 199) and publications on accuracy of 3D-printed vs vacuum-formed retainers/splints (2018–2024). Actual values may vary slightly depending on thickness and clinical protocol.

whyChooseUs.label: Why APM Digital Lab
whyChooseUs.title: Proven. Precise. Repeatable.
whyChooseUs.subtitle: In Poland, over 80% of retainers and occlusal splints are still made by thermoforming. A proven method – but no longer the optimal one.
whyChooseUs.subtitleNote: We offer an alternative that genuinely changes daily treatment outcomes and reduces the number of chairside adjustments.

reasons.title: Precision that cannot be achieved manually
reasons.description: Every splint is designed precisely to the patient's anatomy with ±10 µm tolerance. No thinning, no random thickness variation, no 'almost fits'.

reasons.title: Significantly longer intraoral lifespan
reasons.description: KeySplint Hard withstands bruxism loads better than standard PET-G. Patients with heavy bruxism typically wear our splints 2–3× longer than thermoformed ones.

reasons.title: Full repeatability on every order
reasons.description: When a patient loses a splint or needs a duplicate – we ship an identical unit. A digital file has no concept of 'slightly different from last time'.

reasons.title: Fewer adjustments, fewer complaints
reasons.description: Precise CAD fit means fewer chairside corrections. Dentists report a clear drop in complaint calls and noticeably smoother follow-up appointments.

cases.title: Relaxation splint for a patient with nocturnal bruxism
cases.description: The patient had been through several thermoformed splints that fractured or deformed in occlusal zones. A 3D-printed relaxation splint was ordered with precisely designed 2 mm occlusal zone thickness.
cases.result: The splint seats identically on every insertion. No fractures, no chairside adjustments – the patient finally wears it consistently.

cases.title: Retainer splint after fixed appliance treatment
cases.description: After debonding, the patient received a thermoformed retainer that quickly lost tension and stopped maintaining tooth position. Switched to a 3D-printed retainer with controlled geometry.
cases.result: The splint maintains precise fit without deformation. No adjustments required at any follow-up appointment.

cases.title: Patient repeatedly abandoning their night splint
cases.description: The patient had given up wearing a night splint multiple times due to pressure and poor fit. A 3D-printed relaxation splint was designed individually from their scan.
cases.result: The patient has worn the splint consistently for the first time in years. No discomfort reported from the very first fitting.

cta.title: See the difference on your first order
cta.description: Send us a scan – we'll produce the first splint free of charge so you can compare fit and finish against your current provider.
